summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel and others regarding a Touhy request for evidence in the civil case Jane Doe v. Indyke et al. It discusses the review, redaction, and production of documents, including FedEx invoices and materials from search warrants, related to the Florida investigation of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Attorney from Panish Shea & Boyle LLP who sent the initial Touhy request letter for evidence in the Jane Doe v. Indyke et al. case.

persons.name: Nathan Werksman
persons.context: Copied on the initial Touhy request email from Robert Glassman.

persons.name: Keilah Betts
persons.context: Copied on the initial Touhy request email from Robert Glassman.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of the investigation; a document (a photo) was obtained through a physical search of his residence.

connections.description: Both are attorneys involved in the same legal case; Werksman was copied on Glassman's Touhy request.
Both are attorneys involved in the same legal case; Betts was copied on Glassman's Touhy request.

events.title: Touhy Request Submission
events.description: Robert Glassman submits a Touhy request for tangible and documentary evidence to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in connection with the civil case Jane Doe v. Indyke et al.

events.title: Document Review Completion
events.description: A USANYS attorney completes a review of materials responsive to the Touhy request, identifying FedEx invoices, documents from electronic search warrants, and a photo from Epstein's residence.

locations: Los Angeles, CA 90025 (Panish Shea & Boyle LLP office)
Florida (referenced as location of investigation file)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was processing a Touhy request for evidence in the civil case Jane Doe v. Indyke et al. (SDNY Case No. 1:20-cv-00484-JGK-DCF).

Responsive documents included FedEx invoices from a FOIA review of the Florida investigation file, documents from electronic search warrants, and a photo from a physical search of Jeffrey Epstein's residence.
Many documents that would have been responsive were obtained via grand jury subpoenas and were therefore not being conveyed for review.
The email chain shows coordination between USANYS personnel and a contractor/paralegal regarding redaction and production of the documents.
